channel.title: Kitchen on madewhere
channel.description: Recent content in Kitchen on madewhere

item.title: Weck
item.description: Weck produces a variety of canning and storage jars in Germany.

item.title: Bormioli Rocco
item.description: Bormioli Rocco is an Italian glassware manufacturer. They make a variety of glassware, including: tableware, canning and preserving, and storage jars.

item.title: Vitamix
item.description: Vitamix manufacturers high performance commercial and home blenders out of their Ohio factory. Products which are made in the USA are clearly labeled on individual pages.

item.title: USA Pan
item.description: USA Pan makes a distinctive style of baking pan, offering the usual suspects: baking sheets, muffin tins, loaf pans, etc.

item.title: Zero Japan
item.description: Zero Japan is a Japanese ceramics manufacturer, probably best known for the “Bee House” pour-over coffee dripper. They produce a range of ceramic goods including butter dishes, storage canisters, and salt boxes.

item.title: Epicurean
item.description: Epicurean is a USA-based manufacturer of composite cutting surfaces. They have a wide range of cutting boards and other kitchen accessories. All products are made in the USA.

item.title: Chicago Metallic
item.description: Chicago Metallic is a bakeware company focused on commercial markets. Their site asserts that all products are made in the USA, with global materials. While Chicago Metallic doesn’t sell directly to consumers, they are carried by WebstaurantStore.

item.title: Le Creuset
item.description: Le Creuset is a famous cast iron bakeware manufacturer. Probably best known for their Dutch ovens, but they make a considerable variety of kitchen products. While many of their cast iron products are made in France, the rest of their product lines vary in origin.

item.title: Heath Ceramics
item.description: Heath Ceramics is primarily known for their ceramic products, but they also act as a vendor for a wide variety of items which appear to be from reasonable sources. They list origin of products they carry prominently on individual product pages.

item.title: Heath Ceramics
item.description: Heath Ceramics is primarily known for ceramic goods which they make in their California factory. They’ve recently started producing other products, like flatware. They also carry a significant number of other items which seem carefully selected, but haven’t been comprehensively evaluated. See their vendor page for more information.

item.title: John Boos
item.description: John Boos & Co. are a butcher block manufacturer, known by the “Boos Block” logo burned into the side of their products. In addition to counter top butcher blocks, they also make standalone kitchen furniture (such as islands) and installer materials, like full butcher block counter tops.

item.title: Corelle
item.description: Corelle is well known for their distinctive glass dishware, which is made in Corning, NY.

item.title: Émile Henry
item.description: Émile Henry is a ceramics manufacturer in France, best known for their bakeware. In the United States, they are affiliated with Duralex although that affiliation isn’t clear: it may just be the US distributor is the same company.

item.title: Sherrill Manufacturing
item.description: Sherrill Manufacturing is the parent company of several brands listed below. They purchased the former Oneida Limited facilities, and continue making products in the USA.

item.title: Liberty Tabletop
item.description: Liberty Tabletop is a flatware manufacturer, which is a subsidiary of Sherrill Manufacturing.

item.title: Moccamaster
item.description: The Moccamaster is a highly regarded automatic drip coffee maker, which is made in the Netherlands.

item.title: Peugeot Saveurs
item.description: Peugeot is probably best known for their pepper mills, but offer a small range of kitchen products.

item.title: Demeyere
item.description: Demeyere offers a wide range of cookware, made in Belgium. Some of their specialty cookware, such as non-stick cookware, are made in Italy. A few accessories are made elsewhere. Their website lists the origin for each product on its product page.

item.title: Fletchers' Mill
item.description: Fletchers' Mill is known for their pepper mills, but also offer a variety of wooden tools such as rolling pins, honey dippers, and etc.

item.title: Lamson
item.description: Lamson provides a wide variety of kitchen knives and tools, all made in their Massachusetts factory.

item.title: Staub
item.description: Staub is a cookware manufacturer specializing in cast iron pans and dutch ovens.

item.title: Wüsthof
item.description: Wüsthof offers a wide range of kitchen knives. Much of their core product line is made in Germany.

item.title: Zojirushi
item.description: Zojirushi is probably best known for their rice cookers, but they make a considerable line of small appliances including water boilers and bread makers, a number of which are made in Japan. They also make a line of vacuum mugs and containers, but their country of origin varies.

item.title: ZWILLING J.A. Henckels
item.description: ZWILLING J.A. Henckles is the parent company of several brands, including Staub and Demeyere.

item.title: 360 Cookware
item.description: 360 Cookware makes various cookware, bakeware, flatware, and other utensils in the USA.

item.title: All-Clad
item.description: All-Clad is known for their clad cookware, but the also offer utensils and various kitchen goods. Most of their core product line—pots, pans, and other cookware—is manufactured in the USA. Other products, such as utensils and appliances, have varying origins.

item.title: Cambro
item.description: Cambro is best known for their food storage products, which are popular in food service but also excellent for home. The vast majority of these are made in the USA, at least for the USA market. They highlight all of their locations and purposes on their careers page, as well as the number of employees in each location. Cambro focuses on commercial markets and doesn’t sell direct to consumers, but their products can be found on WebstaurantStore.

item.title: Duralex
item.description: Duralex is a manufacturer of glassware; they specialize in drinkware and dinnerware, and is known for its robustness. All of their glassware is made in France, and can be bought direct from their USA distribution. In 2021 they were purchased by Pyrex, but while sharing a name with the American Pyrex (owned by Corning), Pyrex EU appears to be a different company.

item.title: Solidteknics
item.description: Solidteknics is a manufacturer with seemingly two independent arms: one in Australia, and one in the USA. They manufacture wrought iron cookware in each of these markets.

item.title: Thermoworks
item.description: Thermoworks primary product is handheld fast-read digital thermometers for cooking use. Their flagship Thermapen line is made in England. Products which are made in England are explicitly market on product pages.

item.title: Vollrath
item.description: Vollrath is a cookware and bakeware company, focused on commercial kitchen. A substantial portion of their goods are made in the USA, including their “Jacob’s Pride” line of clad cookware. While Vollrath doesn’t sell directly to consumers, their goods are carried by WebstaurantStore which lists a prominent “Made in USA” badge on relevant products.

item.title: WebstaurantStore
item.description: WebstaurantStore is a large online retailer specializing in the food service industry, but they will sell to the general public. They are USA focused, and will prominently display badges on USA-made goods, as well as allowing that as a search constraint.
